solution_line_template: Gary earned overtime, so he worked at least {normal_hours_threshold} hours. for which he was paid {normal_hours_threshold} hours * ${normal_wage_per_hour}/hour = $<<{normal_hours_threshold}*{normal_wage_per_hour}={normal_wage_earnings}>>{normal_wage_earnings} at his normal wage.
This means that ${total_paycheck} - ${normal_wage_earnings} = $<<{total_paycheck}-{normal_wage_earnings}={overtime_earnings}>>{overtime_earnings} was earned at his overtime wage.

His overtime wage is {overtime_multiplier} his normal wage, or ${normal_wage_per_hour} * {overtime_multiplier} = $<<{normal_wage_per_hour}*{overtime_multiplier}={overtime_wage_per_hour}>>{overtime_wage_per_hour} per hour.
So Gary worked ${overtime_earnings} / ${overtime_wage_per_hour} per hour = <<{overtime_earnings}/{overtime_wage_per_hour}={overtime_hours}>>{overtime_hours} hours' worth of overtime.
So in total, Gary worked {normal_hours_threshold} hours + {overtime_hours} hours = <<{normal_hours_threshold}+{overtime_hours}={total_hours_worked}>>{total_hours_worked} hours that week.
